prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: When, specifically, will Stefan and Suzanne decide to end their marriage, and then file the legal separation for their divorce?

Please note that this reading requires 100% accuracy and honesty in interpretation, regardless of whether the aspects reveal positive or negative energies. The chart must be read exactly as it presents itself, without bias in either direction. If the aspects show negativity, that negativity will be revealed fully. If the aspects show positivity, that positivity will be revealed fully. There shall be no softening of negative aspects, nor any dampening of positive ones. The only acceptable outcome is to interpret precisely what the chart demonstrates through its aspects, houses, and planetary positions - be that wonderful, terrible, or anywhere in between. Complete accuracy to the chart's true message is the sole priority.

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (foreign connection), and Suzanne by the Ascendant's 4th house (Stefan's 7th).

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a catalog of the chart’s raw data relevant to the question, drawn strictly from horary principles:

1. Fundamental Chart Data
 • Question: “When will Stefan and Suzanne decide to end their marriage and file the legal separation?”
 • Query Time/Place: Feb. 20, 2025, 1:01 PM; South Lyon, Michigan, United States
 • Ascendant: 0°49′ Cancer
 • Midheaven (MC): 5°43′ Pisces
 • Imum Coeli (IC): 5°43′ Virgo

2. Planetary Positions (with degrees, sign, and motion where indicated)
 • Sun: 2°20′ Pisces
 • Moon: 2°33′ Sagittarius
 • Mercury: 11°33′ Pisces
 • Venus: 9°11′ Aries
 • Mars: 17°05′ Cancer (retrograde)
 • Jupiter: 11°43′ Gemini
 • Saturn: 19°41′ Pisces
 • Uranus: 23°27′ Taurus
 • Neptune: 28°35′ Pisces
 • Pluto: 2°39′ Aquarius
 • North Node: 28°48′ Pisces (retrograde)
 • Chiron: 20°13′ Aries

3. House Boundaries (noting key houses for the divorce question)
 • 1st House: Begins at 0° Cancer (contains Mars)
 • 4th House: Begins at 5° Virgo (Suzanne’s representative, per Stefan’s 7th house)
 • 7th House: Begins at 0° Capricorn
 • 9th House: Begins at 13° Aquarius (represents Stefan; per cross-reference, Stefan is indicated in the Ascendant’s 9th house)
 • 10th House: Begins at 5° Pisces (contains Mercury, Venus, Saturn, Neptune, North Node)

4. Major Aspects (with orb sizes as provided)
 • Moon sextile Pluto          (orb: 0°)
 • Mercury square Jupiter       (orb: 0°)
 • Sun square Moon           (orb: 0°)
 • MC opposition IC           (orb: 0°)
 • Neptune conjunction North Node    (orb: 0°)
 • Venus sextile Jupiter        (orb: 2°)
 • North Node square Ascendant      (orb: 2°)
 • Neptune square Ascendant       (orb: 2°)
 • Mars trine Saturn           (orb: 2°)
 • Sun trine Ascendant          (orb: 2°)
 • Mars square Chiron          (orb: 3°)
 • Moon square IC           (orb: 3°)
 • Moon square MC           (orb: 3°)
 • Sun opposition IC          (orb: 3°)
 • Sun conjunction MC          (orb: 3°)
 • Pluto sextile North Node      (orb: 4°)
 • Saturn sextile Uranus        (orb: 4°)
 • Moon trine North Node        (orb: 4°)
 • Moon trine Neptune          (orb: 4°)
 • Ascendant sextile IC         (orb: 5°)
 • Uranus sextile Neptune        (orb: 5°)
 • Ascendant trine MC          (orb: 5°)
 • Mars sextile Uranus          (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter square IC          (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter square MC          (orb: 6°)
 • Mercury opposition IC        (orb: 6°)
 • Mercury conjunction MC        (orb: 6°)
 • Mercury trine Mars          (orb: 6°)
 • Moon trine Venus           (orb: 7°)
 • Mercury conjunction Saturn      (orb: 8°)

5. Configurational Patterns and Special Features
 • Stellium (in Pisces): Mercury, MC, Saturn, and Sun concentrated in Pisces, emphasizing mutable, emotional energies.
 • Grand Square: Involving MC (5° Pisces), Moon (2° Sagittarius), IC (5° Virgo), and Jupiter (11° Gemini). This pattern indicates pronounced tension and a polarity between public (MC) and private (IC) matters.
 • Yod Formations:
  – Yod between Pluto (2° Aquarius), IC (5° Virgo), and Ascendant (0° Cancer)
  – Yod between Ascendant (0° Cancer), Pluto (2° Aquarius), and Moon (2° Sagittarius)
 • Additional Notes:
  – The Moon is a last-quarter moon, suggesting a waning phase of an issue.
  – Dominance of Water among the inner planets; mutable mode is prevalent.
  – Most inner planets lie in the top hemisphere, highlighting external or public pressures.
  – The frequency of square aspects (9 total) points to inherent tension.
  – Neptune in Pisces acts as the sole dispositor.
  – Sun and Mercury are positioned on the Midheaven while the IC marks the nadir.

These data points—the precise planetary positions, key house boundaries (notably the 9th and 4th houses representing Stefan and Suzanne, respectively), major aspects, and inherent configurations—establish the groundwork for a detailed horary analysis of the divorce timing.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda Blackwood – Detailed Horary Analysis, Part Two

I. Representative Identification and Relationship Mapping
 A. Stefan (represented by the Ascendant’s 9th house, beginning at 13° Aquarius)
  • Its traditional ruler is Saturn. In this chart, Saturn is at 19°41′ Pisces.
 B. Suzanne (represented by the Ascendant’s 4th house, beginning at 5° Virgo)
  • Its traditional ruler is Mercury (Virgo’s ruler). Mercury is at 11°33′ Pisces.
 C. Note the overlap: Both representatives fall into the mutable, watery realm of Pisces and are found within the stellium on the Midheaven (10th House: Mercury, Venus, Saturn, Neptune, North Node).
  • This conjunction emphasizes legal, public, and formal processes as key arenas for the matter.

II. Key Aspects Affecting the Divorce Outcome
 A. Grand Square Involving MC (5° Pisces), IC (5° Virgo), Moon (2°33′ Sagittarius), and Jupiter (11°43′ Gemini)
  • The polarities between public (MC) and private (IC) matter, with the emotional Moon square both angles (orb 3°), underscore severe tension affecting the marital dynamic.
 B. Stellium in Pisces on the MC (Mercury, Saturn, Sun, Neptune, North Node)
  • This cluster reinforces the legal and formal dimension; Mercury and Saturn (Suzanne’s and Stefan’s representatives) are in aspect, albeit with a wide orb (Mercury–Saturn at orb ≈8°), indicating a complex but undeniable binding influence on the union.
 C. Mars in Cancer (retrograde, 17°05′)
  • Mars is placed in the 1st House (appearance, personal drive) and trines Saturn (orb 2°), suggesting that despite painful challenges (further reinforced by Mars square Chiron, orb 3°), a turning point is building.
 D. The Moon’s character
  • Positioned at 2°33′ Sagittarius and in its last-quarter phase, it signals that the issue is waning. The Moon’s aspects—sextile Pluto (orb 0°) and trine Venus (orb 7°)—point to transformative emotional shifts that, while painful, prepare the ground for a breakup.
 E. Additional tension indicators
  • Mercury square Jupiter (orb 0°) reinforces communication clashes.
  • Moon square MC and Moon square IC (orbs 3° each) highlight emotional discord manifesting in both public and private spheres.

III. Timing Considerations
 A. The Moon’s phase (last-quarter) traditionally indicates that the matter is in its final stages. In horary, the last-quarter Moon often suggests conclusions within one lunar cycle from chart initiation.
 B. The close clustering of key representatives in Pisces on the MC, a house related to legal affairs, implies that the legal processing (the filing of separation) is integral to the outcome.
 C. The cumulative pressure from the grand square, combined with the activations by Mars (though retrograde, it forms a trine to Saturn) and the transformative aspect of the Moon, signals an imminent decision.
  • In horary practice, such configurations often resolve within approximately 35–45 days from the chart’s casting.

IV. Synthesis of Findings
 • The representatives for both Stefan and Suzanne are deeply embedded in Pisces—a sign heavily linked to legal and dissolving matters—suggesting that the mechanism for divorce is both public (institutional) and emotional.
 • The clear tension between private (IC) and public (MC) matters, underscored by the grand square, indicates a painful yet determined process toward separation.
 • The last-quarter Moon sends a strong signal that the issue is now waning in positive marital energy, already pushing toward an endpoint.
 • The interrelation of Mercury (Suzanne) and Saturn (Stefan) in Pisces, despite their challenging configuration with additional harsh aspects (such as Mercury square Jupiter), further cements that the dissolution is legally and formally driven rather than a temporary quarrel.

V. Tentative Conclusion on Timing
 • With the chart cast on February 20, 2025, the lunar phase and the surrounding indications suggest that the decision to end the marriage—and the subsequent filing for legal separation—will be initiated approximately 35–45 days later.
  ▪ This timing points to early-to-mid April 2025 as the period when the decisive action will occur.

The next step is to confirm these findings with precise degree-level evidence for each representative and to document any limiting factors. Please review these data points and advise if additional verification is needed before final interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda Blackwood – Final Synthesis for Horary Reading

1. Representative Confirmation and Chart Dynamics
 • Stefan (Ascendant’s 9th house, 13° Aquarius) is represented by Saturn, located at 19°41′ Pisces, emphasizing the legal and formal background of the matter.
 • Suzanne (Ascendant’s 4th house, 5° Virgo) is represented by Mercury (Virgo’s ruler) positioned at 11°33′ Pisces. Both representatives reside in a Piscean stellium on the Midheaven (10th House), indicating the decisive role of public, legal, and institutional factors in the divorce process.
 • The grand square (MC at 5° Pisces, IC at 5° Virgo, Moon at 2°33′ Sagittarius, Jupiter at 11°43′ Gemini) reflects intense tension between private (IC) and public (MC) spheres; the Moon’s involvement—in its last-quarter phase—signals a waning of the marital union and an imminent conclusion.
 • Harsh aspects, including the Moon square both the MC and IC (orb 3° each), Mercury square Jupiter (orb 0°) and Mars square Chiron (orb 3°), underscore communication breakdowns and painful emotional conflicts.

2. Timing Indicators
 • The last-quarter Moon suggests that the matter is nearing its conclusion, relating to the traditional horary expectation that a last-quarter phase prompts resolution within one lunar cycle.
 • The aggregate configuration—especially the clusters in Pisces and the activation of Mars (17°05′ Cancer, retrograde, yet trining Saturn at 2° orb)—implies a rapid progression toward decisive action despite the underlying tension.
 • Based on the chart’s initiation on February 20, 2025, the inherent energies point to the decisive move toward ending the marriage and filing for legal separation to occur approximately 35–45 days later, falling in early to mid-April 2025.

3. Conclusive Findings and Specific Insights
 • The merging of legal indicators (the Piscean stellium on the Midheaven), the polarizing grand square, and the finality suggested by the waning Moon all converge on a timeline that favors an imminent decision.
 • The negative aspects—Harsh squares and oppositions—indicate that the situation is not a soft or gradual drifting apart but rather a definitive, perhaps even abrupt, break prompted by severe internal conflicts and public exigencies.
 • The legal separation will reflect not only an emotional disintegration but also an agreed-upon formal process propelled by institutional forces; internal resistance or reconciliation efforts appear minimal in light of the dominant Piscean energies.

Based on the above data analysis, the strongest and most data-supported outcome is that Stefan and Suzanne will decide to end their marriage and file for legal separation early to mid-April 2025. Any further refinements would require supplemental observational cycles post-decision.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: One more question. I have other horary charts that point to the actual DECISION to file for divorce happening anywhere from early-March to mid-March, and then the legal process happening at the April timing that you have outlined here. Do the current chart elements support this, or negate it?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
The current chart elements center on the decisive, legal, and public dimensions of the divorce, as highlighted by the Piscean stellium on the Midheaven and the grand square involving the MC and IC. The last-quarter Moon strongly indicates that the resolution—in this case, the filing for legal separation—clusters near the completion of a lunar cycle, which our analysis situates around early-to-mid April 2025.

Regarding an earlier internal decision to divorce (a shift that might occur in early-to-mid March), the chart does not distinctly mark this phase as a publicly or institutionally significant turning point. The forces present (for example, the tension revealed in the Moon’s involvement with both the MC and IC and the decisive nature of the legal-sector indicators) point more toward the final outward action being timed in early-to-mid April. This leaves room for a possible internal or private decision preceding the formal legal act, but the visible, data-supported threshold—the filing that marks the final legal separation—is strongly aligned with the April period.

Thus, the current chart elements do not decisively support a separate, earlier divorce decision phase in March; instead, they indicate that the full, legal severance will manifest in early-to-mid April 2025.
